results.title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
results.creator_credit: Sidney A. Franklin, Sam Zimbalist and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A dramatic portrayal of the romance of poets, Elizabeth Barrett (Jennifer Jones) and Robert Browning (Bill Travers). The invalid poetess who regains her health after falling in love with the famous poet elopes with the poet against the wishes of her tyrannical father (John Gielgud), who exhibits an incestuous attachment for Elizabeth, as well as an over domineering control of all the Barrett siblings in their personal adult relationships. The story is set in London, England, starting in the year, 1845. Cast also includes Virginia McKenna, Susan Stephen, Vernon Gray.

results.title: Stagecoach (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Walter Wanger and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the story “Stage to Lordsburg” by Ernest Haycox. Passengers on a stagecoach heading for Lordsburg, New Mexico have a rough trip, during which Curly, the sheriff who is riding shotgun, arrests the Ringo Kid (John Wayne), who has broken out of prison to shoot it out with the Plummer brothers. Enroute, one passenger, a young officer’s wife, gives birth, with the aid of the Dr. Boone, an alcoholic and Dallas, a beautiful woman of questionable repute. Shortly thereafter, the stagecoach is attacked by Apaches. When they finally arrive in Lordsburg, Curly allows Ringo to settle his dispute, and make a getaway with Dallas, with whom he has fallen in love.

results.title: My man Godfrey (1957)
results.creator_credit: Henry Koster, Ross Hunter and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: This remake of the classic 1936 screwball comedy, stars June Allyson in the key role of the kooky heiress who falls for her butler. David Niven plays the apparently impoverished butler, employed by a wealthy, if decidedly eccentric family. Once immersed in their employ, Godfrey’s presence causes endless turmoil, firstly when Irene falls hopelessly in love with him, and secondly when her jealous sister tries to frame him for theft. Set in Depression-era America, this is a delightfully light-hearted comedy that also comments on the importance of compassion. Based on the novel by Eric Hatch.

results.title: The Hordern mystery
results.brief_description: A crime drama, based on the novel of same title by Edmund Finn, in which a transfer of identity becomes a fraudulent way of gaining a millionaire’s money by bigamously marrying his daughter. Cast includes Godfrey Cass, Thomas Sinclair, Beatrice Hamilton, Claude Turton, Floris StGeorge, Flo Little. Silent film with intertitles.

results.title: The Moth of Moonbi
results.creator_credit: Charles Chauvel and Australian Film Productions
results.brief_description: Charles Chauvel’s first feature tells the story of a country girl, Dell Ferris (the Moth of Moonbi), drawn to the bright lights of the big city where her inheritance is soon frittered away with high society revelling. A wiser Dell returns to Moonbi Station where she is beset by the cattle rustler Jack Bronson, but finally finds peace and happiness with the faithful head stockman, Tom. Cast includes Darla Townend, Colleen Richards, Charles O’Mara, Marsden T. Hassell, Doris Ashwin, Arthur Tauchert.

results.title: Greenhide
results.creator_credit: Charles Chauvel and Australian Film Productions
results.brief_description: Out of boredom, a high society girl visits her father’s outback cattle station. After several adventures involving a gang of ruthless cattle duffers, she falls in love with the manager of the station. Cast includes Elsie Sylvaney, Bruce Gordon, Jules Murray-Prior, Irma Deardon, Frank thorn, alfred Greenup, Gerald Barlow. Silent film with intertitles.

results.title: The Romantic story of Margaret Catchpole
results.brief_description: A melodrama about a young girl sentenced to transportation to New South Wales for stealing a horse to save her lover from the excise men. Cast includes Lottie Lyell, Raymond Longford, Augustus Neville, Sybil Wilde.

results.title: The Rock
results.creator_credit: Michael Bay, Don Simpson, Jerry Bruckheimer, Don Simpson/Jerry Bruckheimer Films and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Action thriller set on the island of Alcatraz where 81 tourist hostages are being held by a somewhat unstable Marine Corps general called Francis X. Hummel (Ed Harris). The ransom is $100 million for war reparations to the families of servicemen killed in covert operations and if this is not paid then Hummel and his men will bomb San Francisco with deadly gas. Enter FBI chemical weapons expert Stanley Goodspeed (Nicolas Cage) and former British spy Jack Patrick Mason (Sean Connery) whose assignment is to penetrate Alcatraz and stop Hummel at all cost. Fast-paced and frenetic.

results.title: G.I. Jane
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Demi Moore, Roger Birnbaum, Suzanne Todd and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Addressing the issue of whether women belong on the battlefield, Ridley Scott’s “G. I. Jane” stars a seriously buffed Demi Moore in the title role as an ambitious Lieutenant, keen to make it as a navy SEAL. Pitted against a ruthless commander (a pre-“Lord of the Rings” Viggo Mortensen) Jordan’s quest is damned by the corrupt presence of a female Senator, who must stage-manage the recruit’s failure for political gain. A fantastic premise is at times left aside for detailing of military training sequences that involve your standard “spit in your face and kick you when you are down” routines. Cast also includes Anne Bancroft, Jason Beghe.

results.title: Jack
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Fred Fuchs, Ricardo Mestres, American Zoetrope and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: When a baby is born at ten weeks gestation, he ends up a child living in a man’s body. Kept at home by his parents, Jack is finally forced to enrol in the fourth grade but his physical appearance (as a forty year old man) is the cause of much derision. Confused, and upset, Jack seeks the company of older women whilst being mentored by a caring teacher. A comedy that seeks to convey the multitudinous talents of Robin Williams, “Jack” works must less effectively than its obvious influence “Big” (1988, Penny Marshall), but still succeeds as an intermittently charming comedy about family, childhood and self-acceptance. Cast also includes Diane Lane, Jennifer Lopez, Brian Kerwin, Bill Cosby. Allan Rich.
